items.title: US judge dismisses criminal case against ex-FBI chief James Comey
items.summary: James Comey was charged in September with making false statements to Congress.

items.title: Government injects $41.8 Million into domestic violence helpline
items.summary: The Australian government has announced a $41.8 million funding boost for 1800RESPECT, the national domestic violence helpline, to expand access to its 24/7 support services.

items.title: Victoria Police banned racial profiling a decade ago. Has it made a difference?
items.summary: Researchers said that in 2024, Aboriginal people were 15 times more likely to be searched by Victoria Police than white people.

items.title: 'A $96 million fiasco': BoM under pressure over website redesign cost blowout
items.summary: The BoM website is one of the most popular in Australia, with millions visiting each day for their weather forecasts.

items.title: Ashwini's biggest concerns now will cost the country 'billions' in the future
items.summary: Children are growing more anxious and worried as they age, a new report says. Failing to address their concerns is costly.

items.title: 'It's just impossible': The rental crisis pushing working families to the brink
items.summary: Rental stress is at its worst levels on record, with renters in one city now spending nearly a third of their income on housing.

items.title: What Black Friday sales shopping does to your brain, and how to stay in control
items.summary: Black Friday feels like a celebration of savings, but it is also a masterclass in behavioural and brain science.

items.title: The law that makes me wish my daughter’s alleged murderer was still alive
items.summary: A coronial inquest found Sandi Harvey's daughter was murdered. But she'll never know if the alleged killer was found guilty or not.

items.title: Fifty schoolchildren escape mass kidnapping in Nigeria, but hundreds still missing
items.summary: If confirmed, Friday's attack on St Mary's School would be Nigeria's worst school abduction since the kidnapping of 276 girls by Boko Haram in 2014.

items.title: What we know about Israel's latest strike on Hezbollah in Beirut
items.summary: The strike came a week before Pope Leo was set to land in Lebanon on his first foreign trip.

items.title: A 'massive' number of wildlife die on our roads. Experts say protections are falling far short
items.summary: Wildlife-safe road features remain largely optional, a “nice-to-have, not need-to-have”, the author of new research warns.

items.title: Darwin escapes major damage as residents praised for heeding Cyclone Fina warnings
items.summary: The storm was the strongest cyclone to approach Darwin since Tracy in 1974, but there were no reports of serious injuries or damage.

items.title: How a major MAGA figure went from Trump devotee to calling quits on Congress
items.summary: Marjorie Taylor Greene announced her resignation this weekend after a dramatic falling out with the president that was months in the making.

items.title: 'No way out': Vietnam flooding death toll reaches 90 as search continues for missing
items.summary: Relentless rain has lashed south-central Vietnam since late October and popular holiday destinations have been hit by several rounds of flooding.

items.title: 'You don't have the freedom to leave': The human cost of Australia's solar boom
items.summary: As Australia's uptake of solar panels booms, human rights groups have raised alarm about links to Uyghur forced labour in the supply chain.

items.title: The two words missing from the world's most important climate conference agreement
items.summary: An agreement on climate action has been reached at COP30 in Brazil — but not everyone is happy with the final result.

items.title: Some world leaders make decisions while chronically sleep-deprived. Should they?
items.summary: Sleep deprivation undermines our ability to think clearly. So what should we make of leaders who say they run on just a few hours?

items.title: Owed $10,000, Khoa was left stranded on a farm with no food or funds. He's not alone
items.summary: Despite recent reforms, exploitation of migrant workers remains a serious issue in Australia, experts say.

items.title: Five key moments from Trump's surprisingly warm meeting with Zohran Mamdani
items.summary: After months of trading barbs, the US president and incoming New York City mayor found some unexpected common ground.

items.title: 'The odds are against us': Why some Australian homeowners may never upgrade
items.summary: The property ladder has changed since the COVID-19 pandemic. Data shows some homeowners may never get the chance to upgrade.

items.title: Potential 'severe' consequences: Why you won't be allowed to use these on some flights
items.summary: Rules around power banks are increasingly tightening after a string of incidents. How do you know if yours is safe?

items.title: Bec quit the career she loved because of racism. Her experience isn't unique
items.summary: Almost half of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander workers have acquired physical or mental injury at work, compared to less than one third of the non-Indigenous workforce.

items.title: 'Daily challenge': The hidden cost of living crisis affecting families
items.summary: A food relief charity says it has so much demand it's forced to turn schools away.

items.title: PNG questions 'what planet' the Opposition is on, after it ditches net zero support
items.summary: Papua New Guinea's foreign minister has said the Opposition's position on climate change "won't do them any favours, or us any favours".
